\subsection{Detailed Description}
This is the base class for all graphical objects which holds information about the dimensions and the background color.\par
 As it implements the \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObservable}{GObservable} class, all graphical objects can be observed. This will be used in \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1P300KeyboardHandler}{P300KeyboardHandler} to notify all interested observers that a symbol has been flashed or selected.\par
 GObjects cannot be instantiated directly. The constructor can only be called by derived graphical objects.\par
 Each graphical object knows how to draw itself. To this end the \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_a00e373a12688223086a334eae0436332}{draw()} function should be implemented.\par
 Each graphical object can choose to either use OpenGL Display Lists or OpenGL Vertex Buffer Objects. This display lists or vbo's hold the OpenGL code and the data that is necessary for drawing the object\par
 Note: OpenGL Vertex Buffer Objects can not yet be used for drawing \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol}{GSymbol} objects as this requires a library that uses display lists for rendering fonts, the use of Display Lists is however deprecated. For now although VBO functionality is there, all graphical objects will use Display Lists for rendering.\par
 Each graphical object also has a resource manager \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1OpenGLResourceManager}{OpenGLResourceManager}. This object keeps track of the display list or vbo identifiers.\par

\hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_a171fa9ae712d7bf7c9fe0ec74a95835e}{
\index{OpenViBEApplications::GObject@{OpenViBEApplications::GObject}!deleteAndCreateGLResources@{deleteAndCreateGLResources}}
\index{deleteAndCreateGLResources@{deleteAndCreateGLResources}!OpenViBEApplications::GObject@{OpenViBEApplications::GObject}}
\subsubsection[{deleteAndCreateGLResources}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void GObject::deleteAndCreateGLResources (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
{}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily  \mbox{[}protected, virtual\mbox{]}}}}
\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_a171fa9ae712d7bf7c9fe0ec74a95835e}
This deletes the resource manager \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1OpenGLResourceManager}{OpenGLResourceManager} and decreases the use count of the resources and then requests OpenGL for new resources. This is necessary for example when the dimension parameters of \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject}{GObject} change and the display list or vbo has to be recreated/recomputed. So we have to delete the old resource, ask for a new resource identifier and create new OpenGL code associated with the new resource identifier. The latter operation is done in the specific derived class, not in \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject}{GObject}. \hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_a00e373a12688223086a334eae0436332}{
\index{OpenViBEApplications::GObject@{OpenViBEApplications::GObject}!draw@{draw}}
\index{draw@{draw}!OpenViBEApplications::GObject@{OpenViBEApplications::GObject}}
\subsubsection[{draw}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}virtual void OpenViBEApplications::GObject::draw (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
{}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily  \mbox{[}pure virtual\mbox{]}}}}
\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_a00e373a12688223086a334eae0436332}
This method should contain the OpenGL code to draw on the back buffer and it has to be implemented by every class that inherits from \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject}{GObject}. In \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1P300MainContainer}{P300MainContainer} the buffers will be swapped and the glFinish() function will be called in order to actually show the changes on the screen and sync the event with the EEG data. 

Implemented in \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GButton_abde44c49c9f5ab97d7398864ff15969d}{OpenViBEApplications::GButton}, \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GContainer_a5ae508ebbc61d807143db96ee2f96883}{OpenViBEApplications::GContainer}, \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GLabel_ac94194b56ef4517fd62d6a1f68661a18}{OpenViBEApplications::GLabel}, \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GPictureSymbol_ae4599b766493b68a3be8d0002cb7eb59}{OpenViBEApplications::GPictureSymbol}, \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol_a45a39e83701c4692f97d7b82a6fd7567}{OpenViBEApplications::GSymbol}, \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GTable_a85f6227c147fbbfee5afc93fbd3dcaf0}{OpenViBEApplications::GTable}, and \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1P300MainContainer_a4a7058842de36b427233d89cd49be17c}{OpenViBEApplications::P300MainContainer}.

\index{getGLResourceID@{getGLResourceID}!OpenViBEApplications::GObject@{OpenViBEApplications::GObject}}
\subsubsection[{getGLResourceID}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}GLuint GObject::getGLResourceID (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{OpenViBE::uint32}]{gl\_\-index}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
) const\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily  \mbox{[}protected, virtual\mbox{]}}}}
\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_afecc53f0fa38c61ac826b97e5e9eca74}

\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em gl\_\-index} & the index of the OpenGL resource identifier you want. If \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject}{GObject} is created with n number of display lists or vbo's then you can access the first by gl\_\-index=0, the second by gl\_\-index=1 etc. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
the resource id that is associated with the preconstructed OpenGL display list or vbo in video memory. 
\end{DoxyReturn}

\hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_a0d98d6206359e7b57a30e90a9f105bf8}{
\index{OpenViBEApplications::GObject@{OpenViBEApplications::GObject}!operator=@{operator=}}
\index{operator=@{operator=}!OpenViBEApplications::GObject@{OpenViBEApplications::GObject}}
\subsubsection[{operator=}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf GObject} \& GObject::operator= (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf GObject} const \&}]{gobject}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily  \mbox{[}protected\mbox{]}}}}
\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_a0d98d6206359e7b57a30e90a9f105bf8}
Assignment operator, an internal variable is set to indicate that the state of the object has changed so that the next call to \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_a00e373a12688223086a334eae0436332}{draw()} actually redraws the object. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em gobject} & the object that is assigned to this. The own OpenGL resource manager \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1OpenGLResourceManager}{OpenGLResourceManager} is deleted and the one of gobject is cloned so that the same OpenGL video resources are reused (more efficient). \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

\hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_a6142ac58568e334e50c3eae060590f82}{
\index{OpenViBEApplications::GObject@{OpenViBEApplications::GObject}!setDimParameters@{setDimParameters}}
\index{setDimParameters@{setDimParameters}!OpenViBEApplications::GObject@{OpenViBEApplications::GObject}}
\subsubsection[{setDimParameters}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void GObject::setDimParameters (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf BoxDimensions}}]{dim}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily  \mbox{[}virtual\mbox{]}}}}
\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GObject_a6142ac58568e334e50c3eae060590f82}
Sets the x, y, height, width and depth parameters of the object. It also sets the internal state of the object to changed. It will also call deleteAndCreateGLResources because the code needs to be rewritten to graphical memory with the new dimensions and thus new resources need to be created and the old ones deleted 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em dim} & the dimensions of the object (in OpenGL units, \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1P300MainContainer}{P300MainContainer} redefines the space so that 1 unit is 1 pixel). \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
